source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plants tufted (often including a short, oblique rhizome), leaves pungent-pointed; panicle oblong to narrow-cylindric, 2–4 cm long; awns of lemma not more than twice as long as body; far north-west only

Plants with creeping, horizontal rhizomes, leaves obtuse or acute but not pungent-pointed; panicle ovoid, mostly less than 2 cm long; awns of lemma at least twice as long as body; mainly in the southern part of State, rare in Little and Big Deserts
